de.tum.bgu.lfk.processing.button

Class SimpleButton

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.tum.bgu.lfk.processing.button.SimpleButton

  • public class SimpleButton
extends java.lang.Object
    a simple button class to use within processing. action handling should by done via the e.g. mouseClicked() functions etc.
    at the moment the button does not adjust themself to the caption (text)
    Since:
    12.06.2014
    Version:
    0.0.2
    Author:
    Mathias Jahnke, Technische Universität München, Department of Cartography

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SimpleButton()
      default constructor
      should not be used!
      SimpleButton(processing.core.PApplet p, float x, float y, float buttonWidth, float buttonHeight)
      parameterized constructor.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void drawButton()
      draws the button every time the function is called should be placed within draw-function of the processing sketch
      java.lang.String getButtonText()
      return the text to display with the button
      boolean isClicked()
      return true if the button is clicked otherwise false
      boolean isInside(float x, float y)
      checks if the x and y coordinates are falling inside the button area
      void setButtonLook(java.lang.Integer buttonStroke, java.lang.Integer buttonStrokeHighlight, java.lang.Integer buttonFill, java.lang.Integer buttonFillHighlight)
      set the outline and stroke color of the button if not called standard values are used at this stage only int values can be passed to the function to use this function with rgb colors use the color()-function as an argument. the color() function will map the rgb values to a integer
      void setButtonText(java.lang.String text, int buttonTextColor, int buttonTextColorHighlight)
      sets the caption (text) of the button and the styling of the caption
      void setButtonText(java.lang.String text, processing.core.PFont buttonFont, int buttonTextColor, int buttonTextColorHighlight) 
      void setClicked(boolean clicked)
      set to true if the button is clicked
      void setCornerRadius(int cornerRadius)
      to set the corner radius of the button
      void setOutlineWeight(int outlineWeight)
      to set the outline weight of the button (stroke thickness)

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • SimpleButton

        public SimpleButton()
        default constructor
        should not be used!

      • SimpleButton

        public SimpleButton(processing.core.PApplet p,
            float x,
            float y,
            float buttonWidth,
            float buttonHeight)
        parameterized constructor. x, y will specify the center point of the button object.
        Parameters:
        x - x-value of the button's center point in screen coordinates (pixel)
        y - y-value of the button's center point in screen coordinates (pixel)
        buttonWidth - width of the button in pixel
        buttonHeight - height of the button in pixel

    • Method Detail

        public boolean isClicked()
        return true if the button is clicked otherwise false

        public void setOutlineWeight(int outlineWeight)

      • drawButton

        public void drawButton()
        draws the button every time the function is called should be placed within draw-function of the processing sketch

      • setButtonLook

        public void setButtonLook(java.lang.Integer buttonStroke,
                 java.lang.Integer buttonStrokeHighlight,
                 java.lang.Integer buttonFill,
                 java.lang.Integer buttonFillHighlight)
        set the outline and stroke color of the button if not called standard values are used at this stage only int values can be passed to the function to use this function with rgb colors use the color()-function as an argument. the color() function will map the rgb values to a integer
        Parameters:
        buttonStroke - color of the button border if the button is not clicked
        buttonStrokeHighlight - color of the button border if the button is clicked
        buttonFill - color of the button fill if the button is not clicked
        buttonFillHighlight - color of the button fill if the button is clicked

      • setButtonText

        public void setButtonText(java.lang.String text,
                 int buttonTextColor,
                 int buttonTextColorHighlight)
        sets the caption (text) of the button and the styling of the caption
        Parameters:
        text - the caption of the button
        buttonTextColor - the text color
        buttonTextColorHighlight - the text color if the button is highlighted

      • setButtonText

        public void setButtonText(java.lang.String text,
                 processing.core.PFont buttonFont,
                 int buttonTextColor,
                 int buttonTextColorHighlight)
        Parameters:
        text - the caption text of the button and the styling of the caption
        buttonFont - the PFont of the button
        buttonTextColor - the caption (text) color
        buttonTextColorHighlight - the caption (text) color if the button is highlighted

      • isInside

        public boolean isInside(float x,
               float y)
        checks if the x and y coordinates are falling inside the button area
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate
        y - the y coordinate
        Returns:
        true if inside otherwise false
